The FI Formula: Explained

The path to Financial Independence (FI) is built on a simple but powerful formula:

FI Number = Annual Expenses × 25

This formula is based on the 4% rule, suggesting that withdrawing 4% annually from your investments can sustain your expenses indefinitely. Here’s how it works:

  • Step 1: Calculate annual expenses.
  • Step 2: Multiply by 25 to get your FI target.
  • Step 3: Invest in diversified assets to grow toward that target.

Example: If your expenses are $40,000/year, your FI number is $1,000,000.
